meanings.definition: The condition of being unable to sleep, typically resulting in tiredness and irritability.
meanings.sent1: Her insomnias kept her awake all night, leaving her exhausted in the morning.
meanings.sent2: After suffering from insomnias for weeks, he finally sought help from a sleep specialist.
meanings.sent3: The insomnias seemed to have a party in her head, keeping her wide awake when she wanted to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The insomnias were like unwelcome guests that overstayed their welcome, leaving her drained every day.
meanings.sent5: The insomnias were like mischievous elves, playing tricks on her mind and stealing her rest.

meanings.definition: A chronic inability to fall asleep or remain asleep for an adequate length of time.
meanings.sent1: His insomnias made him toss and turn all night, unable to find a moment of peace.
meanings.sent2: Living with insomnias can be incredibly challenging, affecting every aspect of daily life.
meanings.sent3: The insomnias seemed to have a vendetta against him, refusing to let him rest no matter what.
meanings.sent4: The insomnias were like a stubborn lock, keeping him out of the realm of sleep.
meanings.sent5: The insomnias were like a relentless enemy, attacking his peace of mind every night.

meanings.definition: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
meanings.sent1: Her insomnias caused her to lie awake in bed, counting sheep to no avail.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with insomnias can be frustrating, especially when you just want to rest.
meanings.sent3: The insomnias were like a mischievous imp, hiding under her pillow and giggling at her attempts to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The insomnias were like a thick fog, clouding her mind and preventing her from drifting off.
meanings.sent5: The insomnias were like a persistent alarm clock, ringing in her ears every time she closed her eyes.
